title: How to Stir Fry Green Beans

methods.name: Stir-Frying Green Beans with Bacon and Shallots

steps.headline: Saute the bacon with the shallots and garlic.
steps.description: Place a large skillet on the stove and put 1/2 pound (226 g) of chopped bacon in it. Turn the heat to medium and cook the bacon for a few minutes. When the bacon begins to release some fat, stir in 1 large, chopped shallot and 4 cloves of peeled garlic. Stir and cook the mixture for a few more minutes. The bacon should become browned, but don't cook it until it turns crispy or the garlic may burn. If you don't have a shallot, you can substitute 1 small, chopped onion.

steps.headline: Remove the bacon mixture and discard the garlic.
steps.description: Transfer the cooked bacon and shallots to a prep bowl. Pick out the garlic cloves and throw them away. Carefully pour out all of the grease in the skillet except for 1 tablespoon (13 g).

steps.headline: Wash and trim the green beans.
steps.description: Get out 1 pound (453 g) of fresh green beans and wash them thoroughly. Snap or trim the ends off of them. To trim a lot of green beans at once, you can line them up and cut the ends off with a sharp knife.

steps.headline: Stir and cook the green beans for 5 to 7 minutes.
steps.description: Heat the grease in the skillet over medium-high heat and add the trimmed green beans. Sprinkle salt and pepper to taste over the green beans. Stir and cook them for 5 to 7 minutes so they soften.

steps.headline: Stir in the bacon and shallot mixture.
steps.description: Turn off the heat and stir in the reserved bacon and shallot mixture. Serve the green beans while they're hot. You can store leftovers in an airtight container in the refrigerator, but the bacon will become rubbery.

methods.name: Stir-Frying Garlic and Ginger Green Beans

steps.headline: Wash, trim, and cut the green beans.
steps.description: Wash 1 pound (453 g) of green beans and use a sharp knife to cut off the tips and ends of the beans. You can also use your fingers to snap the ends off of the green beans. Cut the trimmed green beans into 2-inch (5 cm) pieces. For a unique look, slice the green beans into diagonal pieces.

steps.headline: Chop the aromatics.
steps.description: Get out a few cloves of garlic and chop enough of them to get 1 tablespoon (8 g). Peel a small piece of fresh ginger and chop it until you get 1 tablespoon (6 g). You'll also need to get out 2 scallions and cut off the green end. Discard the green end and finely chop the white parts. Set the aromatics aside while you fry the green beans.

steps.headline: Stir fry the green beans for 6 to 7 minutes.
steps.description: Pour 1 tablespoon (15 ml) of peanut or vegetable oil into a large skillet. Heat the oil over medium and add the cut green beans. Stir and cook the green beans for 6 to 7 minutes. The green beans will start to brown and shrink a little in size. Transfer the green beans to a plate or colander.

steps.headline: Saute the aromatics.
steps.description: Pour the remaining tablespoon (15 ml) of peanut or vegetable oil into the empty skillet and turn the heat to high. Stir in the chopped ginger, garlic, and scallions. Cook the aromatics just for a few seconds and then stir in 1/2 teaspoon of chili paste. Turn off the heat. Avoid cooking the aromatics for too long because they can burn quickly.

steps.headline: Stir in the green beans and seasonings.
steps.description: Add the cooked green beans back to the skillet with the aromatics. Stir in 1 tablespoon (15 ml) of dark soy sauce, 1/2 teaspoon (2 g) of sugar, 1/4 teaspoon (1 g) of salt and ground pepper according to your taste. Serve the green beans while they're hot.

steps.headline: Combine the sauce.
steps.description:
Get out a small prep bowl and measure all of the sauce ingredients into it. Whisk the liquids until they're combined and set the bowl aside. You'll need to combine:
1 teaspoon (5 ml) sesame oil
1 tablespoon (15 ml) soy sauce
1 tablespoon (15 ml) rice vinegar
1 tablespoon (15 ml) oyster sauce
1 tablespoon (15 ml) water

steps.headline: Wash and cut the green beans.
steps.description: Wash 1 pound (453 g) of green beans under cold water. Drain the green beans and trim off the ends of the green beans. To trim several at once, lay them evenly on a cutting board and cut the ends off. Cut the trimmed green beans into 2-inch (5 cm) pieces and set them aside.

steps.headline: Mince and saute the garlic for about 30 seconds.
steps.description: Pour 1 tablespoon (15 ml) of vegetable oil into a large skillet and turn the heat to medium. Mince 3 cloves of garlic while the oil heats up and then add the garlic to the skillet. Stir and cook the garlic for about 30 seconds to a minute. The garlic should soften and smell fragrant.

steps.headline: Stir fry the green beans with the garlic.
steps.description: Stir the green bean pieces into the skillet and cook the green beans for about 2 minutes. Keep stirring as the green beans cook so they fry evenly and become soft.

steps.headline: Add the sauce and cook the green beans for 1 minute.
steps.description: Pour the sauce into the green beans. Stir and cook the seasoned green beans for 1 minute. Sprinkle black pepper according to your taste and garnish the green beans with sesame seeds or fresh chopped cilantro. Serve the green beans immediately.

text:
Stir-Frying Green Beans with Bacon and Shallots Saute the bacon with the shallots and garlic. Place a large skillet on the stove and put 1/2 pound (226 g) of chopped bacon in it. Turn the heat to medium and cook the bacon for a few minutes. When the bacon begins to release some fat, stir in 1 large, chopped shallot and 4 cloves of peeled garlic. Stir and cook the mixture for a few more minutes. The bacon should become browned, but don't cook it until it turns crispy or the garlic may burn. If you don't have a shallot, you can substitute 1 small, chopped onion. Remove the bacon mixture and discard the garlic. Transfer the cooked bacon and shallots to a prep bowl. Pick out the garlic cloves and throw them away. Carefully pour out all of the grease in the skillet except for 1 tablespoon (13 g). Wash and trim the green beans. Get out 1 pound (453 g) of fresh green beans and wash them thoroughly. Snap or trim the ends off of them. To trim a lot of green beans at once, you can line them up and cut the ends off with a sharp knife. Stir and cook the green beans for 5 to 7 minutes. Heat the grease in the skillet over medium-high heat and add the trimmed green beans. Sprinkle salt and pepper to taste over the green beans. Stir and cook them for 5 to 7 minutes so they soften. Stir in the bacon and shallot mixture. Turn off the heat and stir in the reserved bacon and shallot mixture. Serve the green beans while they're hot. You can store leftovers in an airtight container in the refrigerator, but the bacon will become rubbery. Stir-Frying Garlic and Ginger Green Beans Wash, trim, and cut the green beans. Wash 1 pound (453 g) of green beans and use a sharp knife to cut off the tips and ends of the beans. You can also use your fingers to snap the ends off of the green beans. Cut the trimmed green beans into 2-inch (5 cm) pieces. For a unique look, slice the green beans into diagonal pieces. Chop the aromatics. Get out a few cloves of garlic and chop enough of them to get 1 tablespoon (8 g). Peel a small piece of fresh ginger and chop it until you get 1 tablespoon (6 g). You'll also need to get out 2 scallions and cut off the green end. Discard the green end and finely chop the white parts. Set the aromatics aside while you fry the green beans. Stir fry the green beans for 6 to 7 minutes. Pour 1 tablespoon (15 ml) of peanut or vegetable oil into a large skillet. Heat the oil over medium and add the cut green beans. Stir and cook the green beans for 6 to 7 minutes. The green beans will start to brown and shrink a little in size. Transfer the green beans to a plate or colander. Saute the aromatics. Pour the remaining tablespoon (15 ml) of peanut or vegetable oil into the empty skillet and turn the heat to high. Stir in the chopped ginger, garlic, and scallions. Cook the aromatics just for a few seconds and then stir in 1/2 teaspoon of chili paste. Turn off the heat. Avoid cooking the aromatics for too long because they can burn quickly. Stir in the green beans and seasonings. Add the cooked green beans back to the skillet with the aromatics. Stir in 1 tablespoon (15 ml) of dark soy sauce, 1/2 teaspoon (2 g) of sugar, 1/4 teaspoon (1 g) of salt and ground pepper according to your taste. Serve the green beans while they're hot. Stir-Frying Sesame Green Beans Combine the sauce. Get out a small prep bowl and measure all of the sauce ingredients into it. Whisk the liquids until they're combined and set the bowl aside. You'll need to combine:
1 teaspoon (5 ml) sesame oil
1 tablespoon (15 ml) soy sauce
1 tablespoon (15 ml) rice vinegar
1 tablespoon (15 ml) oyster sauce
1 tablespoon (15 ml) water Wash and cut the green beans. Wash 1 pound (453 g) of green beans under cold water. Drain the green beans and trim off the ends of the green beans. To trim several at once, lay them evenly on a cutting board and cut the ends off. Cut the trimmed green beans into 2-inch (5 cm) pieces and set them aside. Mince and saute the garlic for about 30 seconds. Pour 1 tablespoon (15 ml) of vegetable oil into a large skillet and turn the heat to medium. Mince 3 cloves of garlic while the oil heats up and then add the garlic to the skillet. Stir and cook the garlic for about 30 seconds to a minute. The garlic should soften and smell fragrant. Stir fry the green beans with the garlic. Stir the green bean pieces into the skillet and cook the green beans for about 2 minutes. Keep stirring as the green beans cook so they fry evenly and become soft. Add the sauce and cook the green beans for 1 minute. Pour the sauce into the green beans. Stir and cook the seasoned green beans for 1 minute. Sprinkle black pepper according to your taste and garnish the green beans with sesame seeds or fresh chopped cilantro. Serve the green beans immediately.
sentences: Stir-Frying Green Beans with Bacon and Shallots Saute the bacon with the shallots and garlic.
Place a large skillet on the stove and put 1/2 pound (226 g) of chopped bacon in it.
Turn the heat to medium and cook the bacon for a few minutes.
When the bacon begins to release some fat, stir in 1 large, chopped shallot and 4 cloves of peeled garlic.
Stir and cook the mixture for a few more minutes.
The bacon should become browned, but don't cook it until it turns crispy or the garlic may burn.
If you don't have a shallot, you can substitute 1 small, chopped onion.
Remove the bacon mixture and discard the garlic.
Transfer the cooked bacon and shallots to a prep bowl.
Pick out the garlic cloves and throw them away.
Carefully pour out all of the grease in the skillet except for 1 tablespoon (13 g).
Wash and trim the green beans.
Get out 1 pound (453 g) of fresh green beans and wash them thoroughly.
Snap or trim the ends off of them.
To trim a lot of green beans at once, you can line them up and cut the ends off with a sharp knife.
Stir and cook the green beans for 5 to 7 minutes.
Heat the grease in the skillet over medium-high heat and add the trimmed green beans.
Sprinkle salt and pepper to taste over the green beans.
Stir and cook them for 5 to 7 minutes so they soften.
Stir in the bacon and shallot mixture.
Turn off the heat and stir in the reserved bacon and shallot mixture.
Serve the green beans while they're hot.
You can store leftovers in an airtight container in the refrigerator, but the bacon will become rubbery.
Stir-Frying Garlic and Ginger Green Beans Wash, trim, and cut the green beans.
Wash 1 pound (453 g) of green beans and use a sharp knife to cut off the tips and ends of the beans.
You can also use your fingers to snap the ends off of the green beans.
Cut the trimmed green beans into 2-inch (5 cm) pieces.
For a unique look, slice the green beans into diagonal pieces.
Chop the aromatics.
Get out a few cloves of garlic and chop enough of them to get 1 tablespoon (8 g).
Peel a small piece of fresh ginger and chop it until you get 1 tablespoon (6 g).
You'll also need to get out 2 scallions and cut off the green end.
Discard the green end and finely chop the white parts.
Set the aromatics aside while you fry the green beans.
Stir fry the green beans for 6 to 7 minutes.
Pour 1 tablespoon (15 ml) of peanut or vegetable oil into a large skillet.
Heat the oil over medium and add the cut green beans.
Stir and cook the green beans for 6 to 7 minutes.
The green beans will start to brown and shrink a little in size.
Transfer the green beans to a plate or colander.
Saute the aromatics.
Pour the remaining tablespoon (15 ml) of peanut or vegetable oil into the empty skillet and turn the heat to high.
Stir in the chopped ginger, garlic, and scallions.
Cook the aromatics just for a few seconds and then stir in 1/2 teaspoon of chili paste.
Turn off the heat.
Avoid cooking the aromatics for too long because they can burn quickly.
Stir in the green beans and seasonings.
Add the cooked green beans back to the skillet with the aromatics.
Stir in 1 tablespoon (15 ml) of dark soy sauce, 1/2 teaspoon (2 g) of sugar, 1/4 teaspoon (1 g) of salt and ground pepper according to your taste.
Serve the green beans while they're hot.
Stir-Frying Sesame Green Beans Combine the sauce.
Get out a small prep bowl and measure all of the sauce ingredients into it.
Whisk the liquids until they're combined and set the bowl aside.

You'll need to combine:
1 teaspoon (5 ml) sesame oil
1 tablespoon (15 ml) soy sauce
1 tablespoon (15 ml) rice vinegar
1 tablespoon (15 ml) oyster sauce
1 tablespoon (15 ml) water Wash and cut the green beans.
Wash 1 pound (453 g) of green beans under cold water.
Drain the green beans and trim off the ends of the green beans.
To trim several at once, lay them evenly on a cutting board and cut the ends off.
Cut the trimmed green beans into 2-inch (5 cm) pieces and set them aside.
Mince and saute the garlic for about 30 seconds.
Pour 1 tablespoon (15 ml) of vegetable oil into a large skillet and turn the heat to medium.
Mince 3 cloves of garlic while the oil heats up and then add the garlic to the skillet.
Stir and cook the garlic for about 30 seconds to a minute.
The garlic should soften and smell fragrant.
Stir fry the green beans with the garlic.
Stir the green bean pieces into the skillet and cook the green beans for about 2 minutes.
Keep stirring as the green beans cook so they fry evenly and become soft.
Add the sauce and cook the green beans for 1 minute.
Pour the sauce into the green beans.
Stir and cook the seasoned green beans for 1 minute.
Sprinkle black pepper according to your taste and garnish the green beans with sesame seeds or fresh chopped cilantro.
Serve the green beans immediately.
